content.p: Examine the images above and respond to the following questions.

body.p: Image C illustrates a cell in what stage of mitosis?

feedback.p: Correct. The cell shown in image C is in the metaphase stage of mitosis. The chromosomes are all aligned along the center of the cell.
Incorrect. Image C does not depict telophase. In telophase, chromosomes have been separated and clustered within two newly formed nuclei.
Incorrect. In prophase, the chromosomes are visible but not organized into pairs, and the two poles of the cell are not clearly defined.
Incorrect. During interphase, the nucleus is still intact and you cannot see the chromosomes.

hint.p: This stage precedes anaphase, where the chromosomes are moved to opposite sides of the cell.
This stage occurs in the middle of mitosis.

body.p: What happens in the mitosis stage shown in image A?

multiple_choice.choice: Connections between the copies of chromosomes are broken down.
The nucleus disintegrates, allowing the chromosomes to sort and organize.
The nucleus of a germ cell forms.

feedback.p: Incorrect. Copies of the chromosomes are split during anaphase, not the phase shown in image A.
Correct. During prometaphase, the nucleus dismantles so that chromosomes can split into identical pairs of double-stranded chromatids.
Incorrect. Germ cells reproduce through a process called meiosis.

hint.p: Image A shows the cell just before microtubules completely attach the chromosomes to the centriole.
Image A depicts the cell before metaphase, but after prophase.

body.p: Which choice represents the correct sequence of mitotic phases in the images above?

feedback.p: Incorrect. Prometaphase is not the first phase in the cell cycle.
incorrect. Prophase is not the first phase in the cell reproduction cycle.
Correct. Mitosis starts by replicating DNA in the interphase. The nucleus disappears during the prophase and prometaphase, and then chromosomes line up in the middle of the cell during metaphase.
Incorrect. Metaphase, in which the chromosomes line up in the center of the cell, is in the middle of the mitosis process.

body.p: The image above represents what stage of mitosis?

feedback.p: Incorrect. During metaphase, chromosomes line up in the center of the cell aligned by the centromeres.
Incorrect. Telophase occurs when the cell re-forms two daughter nuclei.
Incorrect. During prophase, the cell still has a nucleus and the chromosomes are not visible.
Correct. In anaphase, paired chromosomes, pulled by microtubules, separate and move to opposite poles of the cell.

hint.p: This the stage before two new nuclei form.
During this phase, sister chromatids joined at the centromere are pulled to opposite poles of the cell.
